subtitle: just a short note before i start on this
beautiful book
on the structure of this particular
narration
this book has copious footnotes and when
i say
copious i mean copious with a capital c
sum as long as one page long or more
now footnotes have always been an issue
when transferring the written word to
audio because of discontinuity of rhythm
and style etc
the footnotes are usually written by a
different individual in a different
voice and at a different time
there are several ways to do it none of
them optimal for listening
one you can narrate the text and then
when the footnote is reached
you say footnote read the footnote
say end footnote and continue with the
original text
the second option is to narrate when you
hit the footnote just insert the text
into the stream without specifying that
it is a footnote
therefore not disturbing the rhythm of
the audio
the third option is to leave the
footnotes completely out of the
audiobook completely
but the footnotes in this book are so
rich in information i do not consider
that an option for this particular work
the issue with the first two options is
that you are inserting different voices
together and it usually does not blend
that well and disrupts the flow of the
storyline
so you can see there is no perfect
option that will please everyone
but what i have decided to do upon
consultation with several learned
sources
is to read the chapters through without
footnotes
and then at the end of each chapter add
the footnote as an addendum
hopefully that is the best solution for
this particular project
i hope you enjoy this narration and the
spirit in which it was intended
i want to personally thank patricia
diane coda robles for granting me
permission
to share this beautiful book with the
world
